key_drivers: Real yields falling (DFII10 1.74%, down from ~1.90% two weeks ago) - primary bullish driver for GC and SI; gold best month in a decade in February (+$516/oz)
Hot PPI data (Core PPI +0.8% MoM vs 0.3% forecast; headline +0.5% vs 0.3% forecast) - hawkish Fed signal, bearish for equities; S&P 500 closed -0.43%, Nasdaq -0.92%
Chicago PMI surged to 57.7 (vs 52.8 forecast, near 4-year high) - strong growth signal but stagflation concern when combined with hot PPI
US-Iran geopolitical risk spike - WTI crude closed +2.8% at $67.02, partially offsetting bearish EIA inventory build (+16.0M bbls)
BoJ hawkish pivot (0.75%, April hike to 1.0% expected) and RBA hike to 3.85% - strong tailwinds for 6J and 6A respectively
MOVE index surging +14.79% today to 73.38 - rate volatility headwind for NQ and risk assets; credit spreads widening (HY OAS 2.98%)

macro_snapshot.gold_etf_flows: Strong inflows ($18B+ YTD; GLD holdings at highest since April 2022)
macro_snapshot.geopolitical_risk: Rising (US-Iran tensions/potential strike; Russia-Ukraine ongoing; global trade uncertainty)

signal_decay.GC: High-conviction signal valid 2-5 days; gold had best month in a decade in February; hot PPI is a mild headwind but falling real yields dominate; monitor US-Iran resolution for reversal risk
signal_decay.6J: High-conviction signal valid 2-5 days; BoJ April meeting is key catalyst; hot US PPI could delay Fed cuts, keeping USD/JPY elevated; signal remains valid while BoJ hiking cycle intact
signal_decay.CL: Slight bearish signal valid session-to-session; US-Iran geopolitical risk is a live upside catalyst that has already partially reversed the bearish EIA signal; OPEC+ meeting Mar 4-5 is key
signal_decay.6A: Bullish signal valid 1-2 days; AUD/USD at 3-year highs near 0.71; Credit Agricole targets 0.73 mid-2026; monitor China PMI (Mar 2) and risk sentiment for continuation
signal_decay.SI: Bullish signal valid 1-3 days; silver futures surged +6.3% today to $93.30; gold-silver ratio compression and copper strength support; high beta to gold moves

fallbacks_used: TradingView for MOVE (+14.79% to 73.38) and SOX (-1.21% to 8098.37) real-time
Reuters/BullionVault for gold ETF flows (GLD holdings at highest since April 2022)
Search news for RBA/BoJ/ECB stance confirmation
Banca d'Italia ECB reference rate for EUR/USD (1.1805)
BLS.gov and CNBC for PPI January 2026 results
AdvisorPerspectives/CNBC for Chicago PMI February 2026 result
data_quality.notes: All primary FRED sources (DFII10 1.74%, T10Y2Y 0.60%, BAMLH0A0HYM2 2.98%) confirmed fresh as of Feb 26-27, 2026. GDPNow updated to 3.0% on Feb 27 (down from 3.1% on Feb 24). Hot PPI data (Core +0.8% MoM) is the key late-session development: it reduces near-term Fed cut expectations and is bearish for equities (ES, NQ, YM, RTY scores reduced by 1 from earlier draft). Chicago PMI 57.7 is a positive growth signal but creates stagflation concern alongside hot PPI. CL score adjusted from -2 to -1 to reflect the US-Iran geopolitical risk spike that drove WTI +2.8% to $67.02 close.
